result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Cool Glover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  2 months straight time, last 5 months at the day reporting center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation IF deemed appropriate by the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:*; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Johnny Cool Glover in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Johnny Cool Glover in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Johnny Cool Glover in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court grants defense request for an adjournment. Case rescheduled PLEA and SENTENCING on 8/10/2015 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Olya Petukhova in court on behalf of Attorney Bowe, defendant Johnny Cool Glover not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, (by phone), defendant Johnny Cool Glover not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for STATUS on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Johnny Cool Glover in court with attorney Olya Petukhova.  Defendant Johnny Cool Glover in custody.  Paul Hauer for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF471 that are attached to the complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Rodolfo Ayala.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Johnny Cool Glover in court with attorney Olya Petukhova.  Defendant Johnny Cool Glover in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT HAS OBTAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnny Cool Glover not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 5-12-2015. Defendant is in custody at County Jail. Both files sent to case prep.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 05-12-2015 at 01:30pm
